The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and smooth, grayish bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. Allophylus ornitrophioides produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by round, fleshy fruits that are edible for some wildlife species.
